ch.iserver.ace.net.discovery
Class Bonjour

java.lang.Object
  ch.iserver.ace.net.discovery.Bonjour
All Implemented Interfaces:
Discovery
public class Bonjour
extends Object
implements Discovery

Bonjour is the default implementation for interface Discovery. Class Bonjour itself is an application level class that uses the Bonjour library, also known as zero-configuration networking (cf. http://developer.apple.com/networking/bonjour/index.html).

Bonjour, formerly known as Rendezvous, allows for three main technologies:

  • Allocate IP addresses without a DHCP server.
  • Translate between names and addresses without a DNS server.
  • Locate or advertise services without using a directory server.

writeErrorLog

public static void writeErrorLog(Exception e)
Writes the exception to the application log file and notifies the upper layer that an unrecoverable Bonjour failure occured.

Parameters:
e - the exception that caused the call

execute

public void execute()
Executes the Bonjour zeroconf discovery process. First, the user is registered. Afterwards, the network is searched for other users.

Specified by:
execute in interface Discovery
See Also:
DiscoveryCallback

abort

public void abort()
Stops the discovery process. To be called only once in the applications lifetime.

Specified by:
abort in interface Discovery
